definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

sentences.english: Thirty-odd years ago, in 1968, some of the stories collected here first appeared in book form.
sentences.chinese: 本書所收故事，一部分早在一九六八年就出了單行本。

sentences.english: It differs from reprinted publication in that a reprint cites sources.
sentences.chinese: 與單行本出版物的不同之處在於再版引用出處。

sentences.english: This series of monographs in the constantly updated.
sentences.chinese: 本叢書的單行本在不斷更新。

definition: serialized/published as a serial (in a newspaper)
to include (in a collection)/to put together (stories, poems etc)/to record/to employ/to recruit
to abridge/to cut a text down to size for publication
collection of documents/library/book series/sequence of data, esp. genome
to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
